alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 5:37PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHAMPTON COUNTY THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 537 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Norfolk International to near Cape Charles. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cape Charles around 540 PM EDT. Cheriton and Bay View around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Capeville, Birdsnest, Kiptopeke State Park, Eastville, Machipongo, Simpkins, Townsend, Oyster, Kiptopeke, and Cheapside. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.
